definition: non-Han people, esp. to the East of China/barbarians/to wipe out/to exterminate/to tear down/to raze

sentences.chinese: “有錢人是很實利的，”我鄙夷的說。

sentences.english: Though cowards flinch and traitors sneer.
Boise was sitting on the steps, watching them with contempt.
sentences.chinese: 博伊斯在一邊臺階上蹲着望着，滿臉鄙夷不屑的神氣。

sentences.english: These writers, by representing dialects in their novels, bravely violated the boundaries between dialects and standard English as socio linguists prescribed.
sentences.chinese: 這些作家以極大的勇氣去表現爲輿論所鄙夷的土話。

sentences.english: They smile and go away in utter scorn.
sentences.chinese: 他們哂笑了，鄙夷之極地走開。

sentences.english: We disdain a man for his snobbishness.
Yet in these thoughts my self almost despising.
sentences.chinese: 然而，耽溺於這些我亦鄙夷的思緒。

sentences.english: We all need love and being loved, no matter in what way.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟敢愛敢恨自力更生，也沒有理由鄙夷人家的下賤。

sentences.english: She said I was a poet and my questioner turned away contemptuously.
sentences.chinese: 她說我是個詩人，然後問路者便滿臉鄙夷地掉頭離開。

definition: to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
